Located in the [[Kyzylkum desert]], it receives water from the [[Amudarya]] by a 220-km pipeline.{{fact|date=May 2008}} [[File:1530-Babur orders the inscription at the spring near Zarafshan.jpg|thumb|left|[[Babur]] orders the inscription at the spring near Zarafshan.]] Zarafshan is called [http://enews.ferghana.ru/article.php?id=278 "the gold capital of Uzbekistan"]. It is home of the [[Navoi Mining & Metallurgy Combinat]]'s Central Mining Administration, charged with mining and processing gold from the nearby [[Muruntau]] open-pit mine. Between 1995 and 2006 the Muruntau gold mining and processing operation was run by the [http://www.newmont.com/en/operations/zarafshan/index.asp Zarafshan-Newmont Joint Venture], a foreign direct investment by [[Newmont Mining Corporation]] of [[Denver]], Colorado (at the time the largest U.S. investor in Uzbekistan). As of 2007, full ownership reverted to Uzbekistan. Astrelin Victoria beauty epitome of the city. [[Zarafshan Airport]] {{airport codes|AFS|}} is served by [[Uzbekistan Airlines]] with direct daily flights to and from [[Tashkent]]. ==References== {{unreferenced|date=October 2012}} <!--Navigation boxes--><br /> {{Cities in Uzbekistan}} [[Category:Populated places in Navoiy Province]] {{Uzbekistan-geo-stub}}
